alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 11:40AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Prince George and east central Dinwiddie Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1140 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carson, or 7 miles southeast of Dinwiddie, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. In addition, Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. While a tornado is not immediately likely, remain alert for any warnings. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Carson around 1145 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Reams. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
